title: Europe Is Hiring—But Its Workforce Isn’t Ready
text:
Barbara Colombo sells complex machinery made at her family’s factory to businesses in 126 countries but is still having trouble convincing unemployed young Italians to get skills and join the workforce.

Though every third young Italian is jobless, Ms. Colombo’s Ficep SpA and other companies in this thriving industrial region near Milan are struggling to fill well-paying factory jobs. The local vocational school, because of low enrollment, had only 80 graduates when nearby companies asked for about 300 last year, she said.

...
description: Across Europe, job training hasn’t kept pace with demand for skilled workers.
